commitResults.messageBody: Added major feature. Now can handle To-do, Deadline and Event tasks.
Added Automated Text UI Testing script. Fixed minor issue in BurgerBurglar.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'branch-Level-7' of https://github.com/landonzhao/ip into branch-Level-7
Refactor BurgerBurglar to OOP: Storage, TaskList, Commands, Ui improvements
Add Gradle support for build automation
A-JUnit: Add JUnit tests for Deadline and TaskList
A-JavaDoc: Add JavaDoc comments to classes and methods
Level-9: Add FindCommand to search tasks by keyword
Implement JavaFX chatbot without functioning backend
Refactor commands to return String responses and connect backend with GUI
Add assertions to key BurgerBurglar classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Core classes in BurgerBurglar (BurgerBurglar, TaskList, FindCommand,
Parser, Storage) previously lacked runtime sanity checks. This made
debugging harder and allowed invalid states to propagate silently.

Adding assertions ensures:
* Non-null inputs and outputs for methods and constructors
* Valid task indices in TaskList operations
* Proper file paths and task list integrity in Storage
* Non-null commands and keywords in Parser and FindCommand

Let's use assertions to enforce these invariants during development.
This improves code robustness and aids future debugging without
affecting production behavior, since assertions can be disabled.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add assertions to task and command classes
commitResults.messageBody:
Several task and command classes in BurgerBurglar (Deadline, Event, AddEventCommand, AddTodoCommand, FindCommand, Parser, TaskList, Storage) previously lacked runtime checks. This allowed invalid states and inputs to propagate silently, making debugging harder.

Adding assertions ensures:
* Non-null and non-blank descriptions and arguments
* Valid task indices in TaskList operations
* Proper file paths and task list integrity in Storage
* Non-null commands and keywords in Parser
* Start and end times for events are valid and logically ordered

Let's use assertions to enforce these invariants during development.
This improves code robustness, prevents common programmer errors, and aids
future debugging without affecting production behavior, since assertions
can be disabled.

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch-A-Assertions into master with assertions
GUI & main: refactor for code quality and SLAP compliance
commitResults.messageBody:
Main, MainWindow, and DialogBox have been refactored to improve code
quality and readability according to project standards:

* Apply SLAP (Single Level of Abstraction Principle)
* Remove magic variables and replace with constants
* Break down large methods into smaller, single-purpose methods
* Use guard clauses to simplify control flow
* Ensure no deep nesting and keep methods under 30 lines

These changes make the main application and GUI code cleaner, easier
to maintain, and more consistent with backend coding conventions.

Merge BurgerBurglar improvements with master

Resolved merge conflicts in BurgerBurglar.java to combine:
* Code quality and SLAP refactors from branch-A-CodeQuality
* Latest updates from master branch

This merge preserves all functional improvements while integrating
the latest master changes to keep the branch up to date.

commitResults.messageTitle: Code quality: Refactor backend and task classes with Javadoc, assertions

- Improved code quality across all Command classes (AddTodoCommand, AddDeadlineCommand, AddEventCommand, DeleteCommand, MarkCommand, ListCommand, FindCommand, BurgerCommand, ExitCommand)

- Added comprehensive Javadoc comments to all command classes
- Ensured task handling and error messages are clearer and more robust

commitResults.messageTitle: fix(storage): correct assert for file path validation

commitResults.messageBody: fix(storage): correct assert for file path validation

Add a HelpCommand that allows users to request guidance within the app. When executed, the command displays a help manual showing available commands and basic usage instructions.

This extension provides minimal in-app assistance and lays the groundwork for future enhancements like loading sample data on first run.

commitResults.messageTitle: BCD-Extension: Merge help command extension into master
commitResults.messageBody:
Merged branch-BCD-Extension which adds the in-app HelpCommand.
Users can now request guidance within the app and see a help manual.

commitResults.messageTitle: GUI: Enhance scrolling and input handling
